definitions: intentionally false statement made to deceive or mislead someone
horizontal position of rest or relaxation on a surface
examples: The detective discovered his alibi was a complete lie
She told a lie about her whereabouts last night
The lie of the land revealed strategic defensive positions
His comfortable lie on the grass ended when rain started

definitions: legal right to keep possession of property until a debt is paid
examples: The bank placed a lien on the property for unpaid taxes
Mechanics can file a lien against vehicles for unpaid repairs

definitions: place or position of something else, especially in the phrase 'in lieu of'
examples: She took time off in lieu of overtime payment
The company offered stock options in lieu of salary increases

definitions: commissioned officer ranking below captain in military or police forces
deputy or assistant to someone in a position of authority
examples: The lieutenant led his platoon through the training exercise
She was promoted from second lieutenant to first lieutenant
The crime boss sent his most trusted lieutenant to negotiate
As the CEO's lieutenant, she handled daily operational decisions

definitions: period between birth and death of a living being
condition that distinguishes organisms from inorganic matter
particular type or aspect of human existence and experience
animation, liveliness, or energy in action or expression
biographical account of a person's existence and experiences
examples: She devoted her life to helping underprivileged children
The average life expectancy has increased significantly
Scientists search for signs of life on other planets
Plant life thrives in the tropical rainforest ecosystem
City life differs dramatically from rural life experiences
Student life involves balancing academics with social activities
The party came to life when the band started playing
Her eyes sparkled with life and enthusiasm
He's writing a life of Winston Churchill
The unauthorized life revealed shocking personal details

definitions: boat specifically designed for emergency evacuation and rescue at sea
examples: The crew launched lifeboats when the ship began taking water
Maritime regulations require sufficient lifeboats for all passengers aboard

definitions: trained person employed to watch swimmers and prevent drowning
examples: The lifeguard blew her whistle to warn about dangerous currents
Beach lifeguards must maintain excellent physical fitness year-round

definitions: rope or line used to save someone from drowning or falling
thing on which someone or something depends for continued existence
examples: Climbers secured their lifelines before attempting the dangerous ascent
The sailor grabbed the lifeline thrown from the rescue boat
The subway system serves as a lifeline for millions of commuters
Emergency aid became their lifeline during the economic crisis

definitions: act or practice of saving people from drowning or danger
quality of being able to save or preserve life
examples: She earned certification in lifesaving techniques last summer
The beach patrol specializes in ocean lifesaving operations
The doctor's lifesaving intervention prevented a fatal outcome
This lifesaving medication has helped millions of patients worldwide

definitions: length of time that a person, animal, or thing exists or functions
examples: The average human lifespan has nearly doubled since 1900
Battery lifespan depends on usage patterns and charging habits

definitions: particular way of life of a person or group
examples: Her healthy lifestyle includes regular exercise and balanced nutrition
Digital nomads embrace a location-independent lifestyle

definitions: duration of a person's life from birth to death
informal expression for an extremely long time
examples: She accumulated vast knowledge over her lifetime of research
The award recognizes his lifetime achievement in cinema
We waited what felt like a lifetime for the test results
This opportunity comes once in a lifetime

definitions: mechanical device for vertical transportation between floors
free ride offered to someone in a vehicle
upward force that counteracts gravity on an object
improvement in mood, spirits, or morale
examples: Take the lift to the third floor conference room
The lift broke down between the second and third floors
Could you give me a lift to the train station?
She offered a lift to her colleague after work
The airplane generates lift through its specially designed wings
Increased lift allows the helicopter to carry heavier loads
The good news gave everyone a much-needed lift
Coffee provides a temporary lift in the afternoon

definitions: person who lifts heavy weights as exercise or sport
mechanical device or tool designed for lifting objects
examples: The competitive lifter broke three records at the championship
Experienced lifters know the importance of proper form
Use the engine lifter to remove the motor safely
The furniture lifter makes moving heavy items much easier

definitions: moment when a rocket or spacecraft leaves the ground
examples: The crowd counted down to liftoff of the space shuttle
Weather conditions delayed liftoff by twenty-four hours

definitions: tough band of fibrous tissue connecting bones or supporting organs
examples: The torn ligament required surgery and months of rehabilitation
Knee ligaments provide stability during athletic movements

definitions: natural agent that makes things visible to the eye
device or source that provides illumination
mental illumination or spiritual understanding
having little weight or low density
examples: Sunlight streamed through the window at dawn
The speed of light is approximately 300,000 kilometers per second
Turn on the light so we can see better
The traffic light changed from red to green
The discovery shed new light on ancient civilizations
She finally saw the light about his true intentions
Pack light clothes for the tropical vacation
This light material is perfect for summer dresses

definitions: process of becoming lighter in color or brightness
act of making something less heavy or burdensome
examples: The lightening of her hair took several salon sessions
Gradual lightening of the sky announced the approaching dawn
Lightening the workload improved employee satisfaction significantly
The lightening of regulations helped small businesses thrive

definitions: small device producing flame for lighting cigarettes or fires
flat-bottomed barge for transferring cargo to and from ships
examples: He flicked the lighter but it wouldn't produce a flame
Keep lighters away from children for safety
The lighter transported containers from ship to shore
Harbor lighters are essential for ports without deep-water access

definitions: tower with bright light to guide ships and warn of hazards
examples: The historic lighthouse has guided sailors for over a century
Fog obscured the lighthouse beam during the storm

definitions: arrangement or equipment that provides light to an area
act or instance of lightning or providing light
examples: Stage lighting creates dramatic effects during theatrical performances
The office installed energy-efficient LED lighting throughout
The lighting of the Olympic torch marks the games' beginning
Repeated lighting strikes damaged the electrical system

definitions: natural electrical discharge of very short duration and high voltage
examples: Lightning struck the tree during the thunderstorm
The photographer captured lightning branching across the night sky

definitions: something having relatively little weight for its size
boxing weight division between featherweight and welterweight
person of little importance, influence, or ability
examples: This lightweight jacket is perfect for spring weather
Choose lightweight materials for backpacking gear
The lightweight champion defended his title successfully
He moved up from lightweight to welterweight division
Don't dismiss him as an intellectual lightweight
Political lightweights rarely survive tough campaigns

definitions: state or degree of being likely or probable to occur
examples: The likelihood of rain increases throughout the afternoon
Statistical analysis determines the likelihood of various outcomes

definitions: act of comparing or representing as similar to something
examples: His likening of politics to theater resonated with audiences
The poet's likening of love to fire appears throughout literature

definitions: feeling of enjoying or being fond of someone or something
examples: She developed a liking for classical music in college
His liking for spicy food grew during travels in Asia

definitions: shrub or small tree with fragrant purple, pink, or white flowers
pale purple color resembling the flower
examples: The lilac bushes bloom magnificently every spring
She planted lilacs along the garden fence
Her dress was a beautiful shade of lilac
The sunset painted the clouds in lilac and gold

definitions: plant with large trumpet-shaped flowers, often fragrant and showy
examples: Easter lilies symbolize rebirth and new beginnings
The pond was covered with beautiful water lilies

definitions: arm, leg, or wing of an animal body
large branch of a tree extending from the trunk
examples: The accident resulted in loss of limb function
Physical therapy helped restore strength to her injured limb
The storm broke several large limbs from the oak tree
Birds nested in the upper limbs of the pine

definitions: uncertain period of awaiting a decision or resolution
West Indian dance where dancers pass under a horizontal bar
examples: The proposal remained in limbo for months awaiting approval
Her visa application left her in legal limbo
Everyone tried the limbo at the beach party
How low can you go in limbo competition?

definitions: small green citrus fruit with acidic juice
calcium oxide or hydroxide used in construction and agriculture
bright green color resembling the fruit
examples: Squeeze fresh lime juice over the tacos
The cocktail recipe calls for lime and mint
Farmers spread lime to reduce soil acidity
Builders mixed lime mortar for the stone wall
She painted the accent wall in lime green
His lime-colored shirt stood out at the party

definitions: focus of public attention or interest
examples: The scandal thrust her into the limelight unexpectedly
He prefers working behind the scenes to being in the limelight

definitions: humorous five-line poem with a distinctive rhythm and AABBA rhyme scheme
examples: Edward Lear popularized the limerick form in English literature
Children enjoy writing silly limericks in creative writing class

definitions: sedimentary rock composed mainly of calcium carbonate, used in construction
examples: The ancient pyramids were built primarily from limestone blocks
Limestone quarries provide material for cement production

definitions: point or level beyond which something cannot or should not go
restriction on the size or amount of something permissible
examples: The speed limit on this highway is 65 miles per hour
Scientists push the limits of human knowledge
Credit cards have daily withdrawal limits for security
The restaurant has a two-hour time limit for dining

definitions: restriction or constraint that limits what is possible
defect or failing that limits effectiveness or capability
examples: Budget limitations prevented expansion of the program
Legal limitations restrict certain types of advertising
She acknowledged the limitations of the current research
Physical limitations didn't stop him from achieving success

definitions: restricted in size, amount, or extent
denoting a company whose owners' liability is legally limited
examples: Limited supplies mean first-come, first-served sales
The museum offers limited parking spaces
Smith & Jones Limited filed their annual report
The limited company structure protects personal assets

definitions: device or mechanism that prevents something from exceeding a limit
examples: The audio limiter prevents sound distortion at high volumes
Install a speed limiter to ensure vehicle safety

definitions: act or process of setting or imposing limits
examples: Limiting screen time improves children's sleep patterns
The limiting factor in production is raw material availability

definitions: informal term for limousine, a large luxury car
examples: The wedding party arrived in a white stretch limo
They hired a limo for the prom night celebration

definitions: large, luxurious car with a partition between driver and passengers
examples: The celebrity emerged from a black limousine at the premiere
Corporate executives traveled to meetings in company limousines

definitions: irregular walking pattern caused by injury or disability
examples: His limp became more pronounced after the marathon
The injured dog walked with a noticeable limp

definitions: act of walking with difficulty due to injury or pain
examples: The athlete was limping after the collision on field
Limping can indicate various underlying medical conditions

definitions: large deciduous tree with heart-shaped leaves and fragrant flowers
examples: The linden trees provide excellent shade in summer
European cities often line streets with linden trees

definitions: long narrow mark or band on a surface
row of people or things arranged side by side
row of written or printed words
particular area of activity or business
telephone or other communication connection
examples: Draw a straight line between the two points
The finish line marks the end of the race
People stood in line for hours to buy tickets
The production line operates twenty-four hours daily
Read between the lines to understand the true meaning
Each line of code must be properly documented
What line of work are you in these days?
The company expanded its product line significantly
The phone line was busy all morning
We lost the line during the storm

definitions: direct descent from an ancestor; ancestry or pedigree
examples: She traced her lineage back to medieval nobility
The horse's impressive lineage includes multiple champions

definitions: quality of being arranged in or extending along a straight line
examples: The linearity of the narrative makes it easy to follow
Mathematical linearity simplifies many engineering calculations

definitions: defensive player positioned behind the line of scrimmage in football
examples: The linebacker made a crucial tackle in the fourth quarter
Middle linebackers often call defensive plays

definitions: football player positioned on the line of scrimmage
worker who installs or repairs electrical or telephone lines
examples: The offensive lineman protected the quarterback effectively
Defensive linemen must be strong and quick
Power company linemen worked through the night restoring electricity
The lineman climbed the pole to fix the connection

definitions: cloth woven from flax fibers
household articles made from linen or similar fabric
examples: Linen clothing keeps you cool in hot weather
The suit was made from fine Irish linen
Change the bed linens weekly for hygiene
The hotel provides fresh linens daily
